page.title: 06A DAY IN A FARMER'S LIFE
page.content: 7.00am {Mr.Meakin}gets up and has breakfast 7.30am Feed chickens. 7.35am Start work. 7.40am Check livestock by counting them and looking for infection of New Forest eye.In summer check one or two corn fields for disease,weeds and wild oats. 12.30pm Have lunch. 1.05pm Start servicing the combine harvester by washing it and checking the engine and replacing other parts. Check other machines. 5.30pm Have tea 5.50pm In summer do any other jobs. In winter it is too dark to do anything out of doors. {Mr.Meakin}likes farming because he is doing something different all the time.He only does that sort of farming he can do himself.
